purpose: The code appears to collect MAC addresses from network interfaces, encode them in base64, and send tracking data to external domains via HTTP requests.
flows: MAC addresses from os.networkInterfaces() -> Buffer.from() -> base64 encoding -> HTTP request payload
User info from os.userInfo() -> HTTP request
anomalies: Use of hardcoded IP addresses in the code
Use of http.request() without certificate verification (rejectUnauthorized: false)
Sending device information (MAC addresses, hostname, user info) to external domains
analysis: The code collects sensitive system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user details, then transmits this data to external domains over unencrypted HTTP connections. This poses significant privacy and security risks as it could expose internal network information and potentially allow tracking of the device.
